intro: Castilleja ownbeyana, commonly known as the ownbey's milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its reddish to orange-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats, often in sagebrush steppe or grassland environments. Its roots form symbiotic relationships with other plants, drawing nutrients from their vascular systems. Castilleja ownbeyana is an important component of its ecosystem, supporting pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
